title: Very thorough and attentive
body: Saw my 2 year old son. Have a full examination to ensure he was ok. Had to be transferred to hospital but cannot thank the dr enough for how he handled the situation

title: Booking Appointment
body: I was given a link from my GP surgery to book for an echocardiogram so I did this and requested a QE appointment.  I received a letter for an appointment forthe Good Hope Hospital on the 19th May 2023.  I checked how much a taxi would cost from my home there and back and it was about ¬£46.  So I phoned the Good Hope hospital to say that I would wait for a QE appointment and would they cancel my appointment.  They said they would and that they would refer me back to the QE.  When I phoned the QE a couple of days ago they told me that I'd been put down as a did not attend which is disgusting.  Fortunately I have now been given an appointment at the QE.  This should not happen and please can you make sure that booking staff do not put did not attend when someone has cancelled an appointment.  Thank you.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good practice
body: Staff were caring and supportive. I felt safe and understood. This was both the reception staff and the Doctor. My medical history was discussed and brought up to date. I was listened to with understanding and empathy. I feel as a new patient happy to go there with any problems I may have.

title: Appointment system needs Improving
body:
I had a problem which did not require urgent treatment, but did not want to use the 8am phone dash to make an appointment, which I think should be left for those who urgently require a GP apptmt.  E consult wasn‚Äôt working‚Ä¶ or at least at 8am every day for a week, wouldn‚Äôt allow me to make a consultation.  So I ended using up 111, which led to a pharmacists consultation, then an out of hours apptmt, which eventually led to a GP consultation.  To my mind, this wasted the time of the pharmacist, the out of hours GP, and, of course, my time.  All of this took 2 months, from beginning to end.

Surely there should be a process of making an appointment, in advance with the practice.  

Once you get to see a member of the medical staff, I have no problems with the surgery‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ it is just the time it takes for this to happen.

title: Amazing care
body: After initial diagnosis I have and continue to receive amazing care. Although busy, they have always managed to accommodated appointments when it has been a necessity, despite limited availability.

title: Great practice
body: The doctor and staff were very friendly and professional and kept me well informed about the procedure ((cyst removal on my head), before, during and after the treatment. It has been a very positive experience all around and I even received a 'brave patient' chocolate coin after the Op.. :) Would highly recommend üëå

title: Good consultation
body: A significant improvement to the service delivery.   The doctor called me back and discussed my symptoms; he was very clear regarding next steps. I was sent links and could pick up forms for blood tests on the same day. Very well organised and managed. It‚Äôs great to see how the surgery and staff are improving. Well done all involved.

title: Excellent experience
body: Had a back tooth removed, brilliant, never felt a thing whilst the extraction was taking place. Can not fault anything about the staff all friendly and reassuring.

title: Great Customer Care
body:
Professional warm welcome. 
My concerns were taken seriously by the Doctor. Great listening skills plus excellent ongoing care 

I would highly recommend this service.

title: My experience of service
body:
What a fantastic department. Smoothly run, plenty of staff tasked with a specific job roll, all tests well explained to you by clearly knowledgeable staff, all questions answered. As a result of the work they have done nothing in the department there is no long waiting between different test's 

If only all out patients departments could take a leaf out of their book they could all run as smoothly as this department 

Well done to all the staff. Best hospital experience ever, and I've had a few over the years. Well done again

title: Nightmare trying to get appointments
body: I rang for an appointment this morning only to be told I had to go through Salvie. So then told someone would ring me. Husband concerned I shouldn‚Äôt wait so took me to minor Injuries at RVI where I was seen, diagnosed and prescribed treatment. They were fab. About an hour after I left RVI got a message saying could I come for an appointment this afternoon.Surely it‚Äôs much easier to phone and be given an appointment.

title: Excellent appointment
body: If am given a choice of hospitals I always choose Lymington. Arrived a little late this morning for my CT Brain Scan (traffic terrible) Nevertheless  I was seen straightaway, staff there were most helpful, polite, kind  & reassuring. Also helped me on with my shoes which I was struggling with. Can't praise them enough &  thank you to  them

title: Fantastic Care
body: I'm always impressed by the quality of care I receive from Shay Lane (Kelman side). They are efficient, kind, and provide a high quality medical service. Well done to the entire team and thank you

title: poor practice
body:
Because of impaired sight, I regularly have my toenails cut at Haslemere Hospital 
On the last two occasions, the same podiatrist cut my nails, and then found when I got home, that the nails were sharp, ragged, and caught on my socks and sheets, so necessitating half and hour with a nail file.

When I asked why she didn‚Äôt file along the top of the nail, rather than across, she said ‚Äúthat‚Äôs how we‚Äôre taught to do it‚Äù

as she has to wear gloves, she can‚Äôt feel the sharpness, and when I complained, she said it was just dry skin!

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Awful Practice
body: This Practice is awful telling you they can't do a routine appointment and then call you on the day and you miss one call and they don't try again Absolutely outrageous

title: everything wrong
body:
Words can‚Äôt describe how bad my experience has been with this practice. I‚Äôve had to ring up countless times to follow up mistakes that have been made, including; incorrect referrals, prescription not sent to pharmacy, and just a general lack of communication between people at the practice. Just this morning I rang up to ask about my prescriptions, only to be hung up on. When I rang back, they said my GP forgot to send the prescription. So 2 days later, I‚Äôm still waiting desperately for anti-anxiety medication. 
This practice makes it impossible to trust anything GPs say, and believe that they are ‚Äòhandling it‚Äô. Because chances are, they‚Äôve forgotten all about you and will not chase up your problem unless you ring back 3 times asking for answers. 
I feel completely betrayed by my own GP, which is causing me more stress than actually helping me.

title: Receptionists non existent
body: Been on the phone all morning just trying to speak to somebody about booking my smear test and as usual simply can‚Äôt get through. Absolute waste of time, doctors are amazing but since covid the receptionists just do not care. Never have any appointments but when you go into the surgery it‚Äôs a ghost town with nobody there. At this point I wish the government would just scrap the NHS cause the service is appalling

title: Impossible to Communicate effectively
body: I was referred to Gynaecology by my GP in April 2023. She referred me as an 'urgent' case. I received an appt reasonably quickly (in    May) but was suprised to read that is was for August, which worried me as the referral was 'urgent'. To date I have left 6 messages for someone to get in touch. All they have is an answer machine. What's the point of leaving a message if nobody gets back to you. Additionally the appointment date falls when I am out of the country. I've tried to tell them but I don't know if they have heard that or not, as they haven't sent out another appointment. My GP has been so understanding, excellent really. Sadly I can't say the same for the Gynaecology department at the moment. No wonder they have such a waiting list if appointments are being made without following up with patients who can't attend. I look forward to some response having left this review, but again sadly I have little confidence that there will be one...

title: Very good practice
body: Very thorough with numerous blood test and other tests. I am a cancer patient and feel assured that the practice is doing what is needed to resolve the issues.

title: waiting on the phone for 30 minutes
body: On the 7th June, I phoned the surgery to ask for an appointment for a blood test. When I phone I was in 4th place, but after about 5 minutes I was informed I was in first place, so I thought I would be answered in a short while, but after 30 minutes I was still waiting, which I think it's far too long. I don't know what was happening. I only know it took to long too answer the phone.

title: Tired of this practice
body:
The staff here are incredibly incompetent and unprofessional and have no idea how to appropriately communicate and engage with patients, especially older patients who do not speak much English. I once witnessed a young man at the reception desk yelling at an older gentleman in English, as if yelling would magically make the man speak and understand a language that is alien to him. This situation only got resolved because a fellow patient stepped in and offered to translate. Surely, the practice should hire staff that reflect the surrounding community and would therefore actually be able to help patients? 

Also, on 3 separate occasions, I have called up at 8am for a phone appointment on the day, only to receive no call at all, and be told by the reception staff that an appointment was never booked. When I was adamant that I had called to book the appointments and would even tell them the time they told me to expect the call, they would just say they don't remember. This has also happened in person, where I took my daughter out of school for her appointment, only to be told there is no appointment. 

I am constantly disappointed by this practice. No improvements came with the new management.

title: Unable to access GP either by phone or online
body: ever since this GP has merged with Modality the service is appalling.  I have waited for 1 hour to get through to reception, then got cut off online form is not responded to, I am unable to get the results from my blood test which was taken 3 weeks ago. This is not acceptable and action needs to be taken immediately to resolve this untenable situation. This is not a progressive service - it is making basic NHS services completely inaccessible to the community which this GP practise is supposed to serve.

title: Long wait
body:
Getting an appointment was a nightmare, I was told to call at 8am for a same day appointment, after over 30 minutes on hold I was told that the only way to get a same day appointment was via the website going through a series of questions which you have to answer just right to be offered an appointment.
When I finally got to see the Dr he was very nice and made me feel like I was being taken seriously. Unfortunately prior to this I had waited for 40 minutes after my appointment time. Halfway through when I asked the receptionist how much longer it might be all she could tell me was that I was next in the queue which wasn't at all helpful.

title: Quick response
body:
I require regular blood tests to monitor a brain condition. The surgery is good about sending text reminders for me to book an appoinment at the local hospital.  As it happened, the day before I was due to have the last test, I had a full haematology blood test at CUH.  I filled in the surgery form asking if I could skip the second test.  Within 3 hours I got a reply signed by the same doctor I used to be able to see at The Moorings. It was great to know he is still watching, despite the anonymity of the 
new online Klinik system

title: Communication
body: Good reception staff but no communication from my doctor after making enconsults, not even to confirm it‚Äôs been received/looked into or when it should be resolved by.. leaving me to feel as though I‚Äôm being ignored and not taken seriously

title: Good when you can get an appointment
body: Good concern over issue, practical suggestions given but purchase one‚Äôs own medication and bandages as required

title: Prpmpt servicre
body:
Quality service and friemdly doctors
 With follow-up stree free
 Great consultation plus timely feeback on check=ups. Good referrals on health issues .

title: Very good all round
body: Got an appointment with a nurse quickly for immunisation and blood test. Was seen very quickly, nurse was efficient, kind and polite. Explained everything clearly. Procedures were painless

title: Oxygen refills
body: Rang yesterday for oxygen a gentleman on phone said that he would order me 4 cylinders of oxygen but then when I asked if I would get them he then informed me can not guarantee anything or how many I would receive.. I told him to cancel my order I would rather go without and go into hospital than have this uncertainty of having baywater play with my health. Wouldn't trust this company to deliver milk let alone life depended oxygen..this is now the last 3times they can not supply a decent order of oxygen.. a disgrace

title: An absolute shambles
body: Been registered there for years. The long ago stable set of GPs has given way to a constant revolving array of locums. Never seen the same doctor or nurse twice in recent years. The practice has recently changed hands so we held out hope of positive improvements. It's as bad as ever. They send out endless texts calling you for check ups. But you can only be ill at 0800 hrs when the phone line opens. Regularly can't get an appointment when you are actually ill. They asked me to do a week's worth of twice daily blood pressure checks at home and then lost the results so when I went for the appointment, it was a pointless effort and the doctor just guessed. Recently was asked (by text) to go for a check up, booked and appointment, got there and they had no record of my confirmed booking. The next appointment is not available for 2 months. We are voting with our feet and leaving this utterly hopeless practice.

title: Great practice
body: No issues finding it or getting here, access to the GP seen fine, GP nice and helpful and provided what I needed.

title: Mixed messaged
body: I was going to pick up some information that was in a letter for a friend who is struggling to walk.  They asked her for help permission and my name who was collecting.  I set off and they rung her to say I can‚Äôt collect.  I contacted them to ask why and I got told she has to send proof in an email I.e a photo I‚Äôd like a passport or D/L I disagreed and asked if the email is secured I did not get an answer I just got you don‚Äôt understand.  I am furious I asked the question as they wanted me to send private documentation via a email address.  The patient I was collecting for is due for hip surgery and unanticipated walk and they won‚Äôt let me or her husband collect just her.  This is a joke she can barely walk.  They say it‚Äôs for insurance detail that she collects herself and they won‚Äôt send by post.  They will send if she sends documentation over by email and they will FaceTime her first to verify who she is.  She is over 80+ years and don‚Äôt know FaceTime what are you people playing at and thank you for hanging up when I said you don‚Äôt understand is your email secure

title: Double check your postcode with the surgery
body: I tried to sign up fo this practice and despite checking my postcode online, filling in all of the registration forms (a lengthy process) and a member of staff checking my postcode was in the catchment area, I have since had a phonecall informing me that they can't take patients from my area.

title: Unacceptable care
body: I was transferred from stoke hospital to have a c-section due to no beds being available at stoke hospital. However once at Birmingham womens they said they wouldn‚Äôt give me a section and we‚Äôre just going to monitor me. I was put on the ward room with 3 other women where one women was in advanced labour and the other 2 weren‚Äôt far behind. I was refused a room in my own until I had a panic attack. Once in my own room, I still needed to share a toilet and shower which wasn‚Äôt working. They then lost my paper work and all my scan photos, didn‚Äôt carry out routine urine samples daily or give me the correct medication. I also explained I‚Äôd been having bad headaches and problems with my vision they just brushed it off even as it got worse. The care I received while there was shocking. Once I transferred back to back to stoke they found I extremely bad UTI that should‚Äôve picked upon if they had done the routine tests.

readBy.name: Birmingham Women's and Children's NHS Foundation Trust

title: Tick box approach
body: Attended a diabetic pre-review with the nurse.  The procedure was carried out in cursory manner just adequate to tick the boxes on the form.  There were no questions posed and the tests of sensation, BP were very brief.  Doesn‚Äôt fill you with any confidence

title: Still no covid protections for the‚Ä¶
body:
Having left previous reviews and vs replied stating that if they know a patient is immunosuppressed staff will wear a mask, I have attended more appointments where this is clearly not the case. My feedback reflects this appointments.
 My notes tell the staff I am immunosuppressed, I‚Äôve had 7 vaccinations and at no appointments have any staff worn or offered to wear a mask, in their reply I was given the option to email the practice manager and all I can say is having complained a couple of years ago about the appointment system, I was told to change Drs if I wasn‚Äôt happy so it‚Äôs hardly worth contacting vs.
The staff should check records and take responsibility for protecting the vulnerable and wear a mask.

title: Good practice
body:
Very helpful and always looking at u very carefully and understanding you more carefully. Giving the very right medication.

One thing I may know that there is many patients at the gp
But I wish the telephone line are working. But it keep showing line busy.  I wish It can be like voice thingy

author: GP thanks
title: Positive experience of G.P.
body:
I had reason to phone my doctor's surgery about a matter this morning.  
Whilst it took some phone calls to get through (although not as many as the negative stories out there would often say), I got through relatively quickly. Within an hour, the phone call was booked, received and a plan of forward action made. The doctor was warm, welcoming and accommodating. At a time when pressures on our Health Service, and GPs are immense, it's important to boost the service with a little positivity. It's important to share the good stories.Thank you.

title: Lack of Communication
body:
Seeking treatment and initial contact was good, blood tests arranged, second blood tests arranged and informed by the nurse that the GP would be in contact to discuss and was also told by the GP they would be back in touch with me for what treatment was needed. One and half months later no contact and on ringing the surgery i was told the results were good but its not surgery practice to ring everyone back, how could we they said. 
My answer to this is because you have a duty of care to your patients and if you expect them to ring back for results then two senior members of the staff should have said this to me and would have happily complied sooner.

title: Audiology
body:
My  Doctor referred me to Audiology and I turned up for my appointment at Newton Abbot Hospital only to be told my appointment had been cancelled! Apparently the cancellation was a mistake. Nobody knows why it happened? 
I was given another appointment and finally saw the Audiologist on 6th April. She wrote to my GP saying she would refer me to Ear, Nose and Throat. 
On 8th June (two months later!) Ear, Nose and Throat say they haven't received a referral from Audiology! It beggars belief. Luckily Ear, Nose and Throat have kindly agreed to backdate a referral request as if they received it in April as I already waited two months being told the appointment was being processed!

title: Swift referral and good result
body: Due to a communication slip-up, a few of us came to our assessment day expecting to have the operation and not knowing about the pre-op. There had been no email nor paperwork, just a text as reminder. The info booklet came afterwards. The phone number did not let us get through either. But all staff did a brilliant job on the op day itself!!

title: Terrible communication
body: I had my dating scan- the man was silent throughout and gave me no reassurance or indication as to what was happening. I also had some small measurements which weren‚Äôt explained. He didn‚Äôt tell me my due date either just told me to wait outside. I had to wait for my letter and ask my midwife questions. Please can you speak to your patients evens just to tell them you‚Äôre checking- a silence can be a worrying sign for someone with history of misscariage. It‚Äôs meant to be a happy time and instead it‚Äôs hostile during ultrasounds.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic Service
body: Great service, professional and friendly. I was seen on time, I was made to feel comfortable during my scan.

title: Professional.
body: Attended the unit at 0930  and seen with various tests to determine my problem by 1130 hrs  then a short while later after being given refreshments informed of the results with advise given. I personally feel that the service given as excellent.

title: Poor contactability
body: Most of the doctors are good. Unfortunately you 'see' a different one every time, many of whom are locums so no continuity. Main issue is getting  hold of the surgery or trying to make appointments. Vast majority are telephone appointments where you have to wait for half the day to be called. There is usually at least a two week wait for one of these. Phone lines are ridiculously busy, with 20+ people in the queue ahead of you. The main method of communication is via the website messaging system, which periodically closes when it reaches 'Clinical capacity' for the day so you can't even send a message and you are advised to use other services such as 111.  It is very frustrating, even if you are technologically competent. I dread to think about how older people cope. And the practice is apparently accepting new patients when it can't deal with the ones it already has. Unbelievable.

title: Questionable allocation of appointments
body: I phoned for an appointment on what could be a serious illness told nothing till following week and would only be a phone call. I phone the next day spoke to different person about the problem and got In Straight away I don‚Äôt see how a receptionists can make that call on someone‚Äôs health. As it was I now have been referred to the hospital for investigation and the doctor  I saw couldn‚Äôt have been more helpful and caring

title: Just awful
body: This practice shouldn't be allowed to continue treating patients. The reception team, or healthcare navigators as they like to be called think they own the place. Getting an appointment is like fighting 10 people all at once. Once you finally do get an appointment the doctor (or in most cases the nurse practitioner) sees you for less than 2 minutes and then they send you on your way. If you have a repeat prescriptions don't expect them to be ready for you or the pharmacy, I'm on day 5 of chasing my repeat prescription which they still haven't issued, claiming the practice is currently merging with another practice. Will that mean more doctors available when you need to see one, probably not!

title: Use the WhatsApp to book appointment
body: Found  it strange at first, but once I got the hang of it, it was ok I will use it now. I‚Äôm happy that I don‚Äôt have to queue up at 8am  in the morning to try and get through to the doctors

title: Fabulous Service
body: I had an Ultrasound and from start to finish I cannot praise this practice enough. From the extremely welcoming, friendly, helpful and complimentary reception staff to the very professional but warm and friendly ultrasound staff all made the experience a pleasant one and all set in fabulous grounds and buildings. Would definitely highly recommend this practice 100%.

title: Bad Reception customer service
body: Rang about possible cancerous moles on daughters leg, receptionist spoke to me in a very patronising and condescending manner as if I was stupid, I only wanted to try and book an appointment,i think the receptionist needs to take extra training for people's skills because it felt like i was getting told off by a teacher, I had to put the phone down I felt embarrassed, definitely changing my daughter from this surgery, it's a disgrace

title: Great practice
body: Had a phone call from Gp . And was seen by a Dr the same day. Sent to hospital for  x-ray and test to be sent for.  Very pleased with practice so far. Never had a problem in 30 odd years.

title: Awful
body: I'm still trying to work out the purpose of this app. I did everything asked. I replied to the sponsor then received an email to say they have looked at it for a final time. I have had one message in total from my supporter after replying to them on one occasion. I dont understand why? So no more share button. I've been left agitated, I don't know who referred  but totally pointless. It's not easy opening. Up font waste your time!!! Annoyed and confused as only accessed the app a few days. I would love to know why

title: Exceptional service and staff
body:
I attended the Southampton hospital today to have my second (left) cataract operation having had my right eye procedure at the end of April.
The staff are unbelievably helpful, the pre theatre checks and the 
provision of various drops were thorough and rigorous. The operations were well organised, totally pain free and over in around 10minutes whereafter I was released to return home with a bag of aftercare products.
I cannot praise SpaMredica highly enough.

title: Didn‚Äôt happen
body: I had a missed call with a message saying I would get a call back shortly and never received another call.

title: Dropped of patient list
body:
In January I did tried to get an appointment only to be told, ‚Äúyou‚Äôre not one of our patients‚Äù with no explanation as to why. This despite actually being a patient for four years. Today, when I went to re register. I checked the nhs Website beforehand to see what I would need. It categorically states, ‚ÄòYou do not need proof of i.d. to register‚Äô. Despite this I took my driving licence. The receptionist said I must have proof of i.d. and a utility bill to register. When I mentioned calmly what the nhs website said otherwise, she forcefully insisted that I would need to bring photo i.d. and a utility bill and fill out a new patient questionnaire which was basically a duplicate of the standard gms1 form. I asked if they could find my previous data records as I‚Äôd been a patient for four years. The same receptionist, stated abruptly, ‚Äúwell you‚Äôre not one of our patients‚Äù.


I understand their job can be challenging (I also work in a face to face customer service role), but the attitude and approach demonstrated to me that they are not there to help the patient. Deliberately obstructive officious and unhelpful was my experience

title: Brilliant Service
body: A request was made for clinical data to the Medical Secretaries, it was dealt with highly effectively and efficiently, the turn around time from the request to receiving the data was incredibly quickly, dealing with tight deadlines imposed on the staff which was greatly appreciated

title: Poor reception staff communication
body:
Firstly I‚Äôll say any communication with GPS or nurses in the surgery have been good.
Where the surgery falls down is reception staff. There seems to be a lack of empathy and caring. Generally they are off hand. Today I rang for advice patient access. I‚Äôve had terrible pain. For all other medical input I‚Äôve gone privately but need Gp to prescribe more analgesia.The receptionist looked on the screen and said but you‚Äôve only just had. This is because I‚Äôm taking the top end amount. She made no attempt to ask me about pain or how I was, or even suggest any help. I asked about patient access. She said to fill in online (but I couldn‚Äôt find) She said she didn‚Äôt know how, she didn‚Äôt attempt to look it up or help. I thought using this service so I don‚Äôt have to phone would be better for reception team. I‚Äôve written a letter and dropped off now - certainly won‚Äôt phone again. I just felt her manner was offhand. In general find all the staff like that. I think they should know  patients  do not want to phone up, it‚Äôs generally done to get help. Luckily I went privately for part of my treatment. There is such a difference in the attitudes of staff in the private sector. They trip over theirselves to help you. They smile. They make you feel valid. When you are unwell you just need to know someone cares. I am a nurse and treat my patients how I‚Äôd like to be treated. So why can‚Äôt they? I really do think they need some training in interpersonal skills. I thought it was very poor today!

title: Great practice
body: A brilliant practice I‚Äôm so many ways. However, on more than 5 occasions in my visits, the waiting room times to see a doctor when you have an appointment are generally 45 minutes to an hour late. You can not however fault the service provided and the speed of response in all of my family interfaces with the surgery are unrivalled.

title: Wonderful staff
body: After struggling to get a consultation for for my hernia operation I was advised to try The Deepings Practice and I'm so glad that I did. Not only was I seen quicker than I would have been elsewhere but it was obvious from the first consultation that I was going to be well looked after as the consultant was so approachable. I am now back home after my operation this morning and I have to say that all the staff involved were amazing. They were so friendly and engaging and the level of care was first class. I cannot thank them enough for their professionalism, their duty of care and their good humour.

title: Excellent patient experience
body: The nurse made me feel at ease and fully reassured. The care and compassion she delivered was outstanding whilst protecting my dignity throughout. Thank you.

title: Unable to contact
body:
I have been trying to get in touch regarding my first appointment with the maternity services and at present I haven't been able to speak to some one or leave a message. 

What a great start to my care, I'm stressed and concerned already.

readBy.name: East and North Hertfordshire NHS Trust

title: GP Service excellent pharmacy very poor
body: Hi I am having problems with my prescriptions again this time 10 days since ordered and still not delivered tried calling 3 times today  on emergency option 2 and waited over 20 minutes each time and no one answers so gave up hence my review . I have no issues with the GP service but this poorly run Pharmacy is bound to reflect badly on the surgery something needs to be done.

title: Great difficulty getting to see a doctor
body: My consultant told me to ask my doctor for stronger painkillers than just paracetamol whilst waiting for a hip replacement. Tried visiting the surgery but told no appointments were available. Rang next day and kept waiting for 20 minutes only to be told once again there were no appointments available and to ring later. This happens every time. The receptionists are unhelpful and almost rude. This situation is quite unacceptable.

title: Great practice normally but bad experience today
body:
Normally I have always found all Doctors to be friendly, show empathy and be attentive! But today I saw a doctor whose bedside manner left a lot to be desired I found them rude with no empathy or even interest in listening to what I said. 
Having said that the diagnosis and treatment I was in agreement with but the experience of seeing this individual was extremely unpleasant! 
Still believe Hamilton Practice is a great practice despite this one individual!

title: Relinquish Responsibility
body: It seems this surgery is getting worse than it was. Now the receptionist rings you to tell you your personal blood test results and advise what diet we should be on. Can't get an appointment with a Dr and you call to speak to health professional at 8am after being in queue for an hour, they call you back at 6pm.

title: Receptionist
body: I ask for a call back appointment and was giving one for 8am the next day and then the next morning I got a text to say that they would  ring me between 8.30am and 9am and then I got a text to say they would ring at 10am and them I got a text to say they ring at 11am and 12pm they text me to say they have been try to ring me but no had try to ring me  so I phone then and the reception would not let me get a word get a in she need to go on a training course to learn how to talk to people.

title: Good service
body: Doctor listened patiently, despite my suffering multiple ailments. She did her best to reassure me, went through my test results, and gave me a phone number that hopefully I will find helpful. I came away feeling I had been listened to.

title: Very disappointing
body: My son had an appointment for 11.10 this morning, he actually got seen at 12.10. If as a patient we were late the doctor wouldn‚Äôt see us. Why is it ok for them to be an hour late?

title: Over-reliance on tech and horrendous telephone‚Ä¶
body:
How many times have we tried to book an appointment via the online portal, only to find that it is either unavailable or, as just now, having spent 20 minutes filling in the required details, the system then tells me it's closing down until tomorrow? 

Technology should be a servant and not a master. Unwell people need human contact and not a "one-size fits all" inhuman approach!

Waiting times on the phone are a nightmare, regardless of the time of day or the nature of the call. Having one person on reception trying to deal with calls and face to face enquiries simply doesn't work!

title: A complete joke
body: Every single appointment I have booked in the last year has been cancelled the day before. These appointments are to administer medication that‚Äôs needed to survive and they think it‚Äôs ok to just cancel at a drop of a hat. Every appointment is cancelled because the nurse is sick‚Ä¶ I‚Äôve never know sickness like it and am now believing they are lying to me!! How can every appointment over a year and longer be cancelled the day before for the exact same reason‚Ä¶ the nurse is off sick again?? I don‚Äôt know how this surgery functions and can cause so much disruption to sick patients. I‚Äôm so disappointed in the service

title: Prompt Service
body: I underwent ultrasound and am very satisfied with the service provided by Healthshare. Prompt communication, professional staff and almost no waiting time - overall very good experience.

title: great practice
body: i had to go to walk-in clinic to have knee x-rays done. i was seen within a couple of minutes and had a very calm and stress free experience. All the staff i encountered were lovely and very helpful.The radiographer could'nt have been nicer and was 100% professional,a lovely young man .Thankyou Fanshawes.

title: Normally had no problems
body:
I tried booking online this morning by econsul it read it wasn‚Äôt accepting online requests.
My partner has been unwell since Tues he fainted he has diabetes & been feeling dizzy.
I telephoned Burney st the recording said I was  9th in line after 1hr 56 mins I was no 1 in line it then got to 2hrs & then it just went to an engaged tone. I have never experienced this before. I called back chose a different option that was a nurse or specialist I was 11th in line.
I gave up & am now waiting for the diabetic clinic to return my call
All the staff are so kind & caring I just don‚Äôt get why the telephone system is so hard to get through.

title: Worst practice in Banbury
body:
How sad that you have to get to the point to write a negative review for them to even consider you, give you some attention and try to get you booked in with a doctor. Such a hypocrisy. And then they get back to you and answer that they cannot find you as their registered patient. I have been with them for nearly 8 years now and in the last 3 years (since Covid) it has been impossible to get to see a doctor. It's like being in a third world country. I don't know if this is the "normality" with every surgery and practice or just with them but I will soon find out because I will register with someone else. If you want my advice stay away from them...absolutely useless, not to mention that the receptionists are extremely rude and unhelpful.
It's a shame that a person cannot see a doctor when they need it considering everyone is paying National Insurance and giving their money away for a service they cannot get. 
What a shame and outrage.
I will give them a call just to let them know that I am actually registered with them and have been for long time, but will tell them to cancel me from their registers. Both me and my partner. 
Shame to you and your "medical service".

title: A Mixed Experience
body: I came in with my husband following an accident in which our car turned over and we were fortunate to survive. I was examined by a doctor who pronounced no serious injuries and that I would be able to go home. This, without any Xrays or scan. Whilst waiting in a corridor on a stretcher,  I overheard nursing staff saying that they were sure I should not be discharged and not long after that the same doctor came and said having consulted his superior, it was all change and that I was to be sent for both a scan and X-rays which revealed I had a fractured rib and that I would be staying in the hospital overnight. The next doctor on duty was excellent. She asked if any of my grazes had been washed and I told her that they had not. The most difficult things in my experience were related to delays in bringing pain relief and a bedpan when I urgently needed them. At 18:30 my husband let the nursing staff know that I needed pain relief and was told it would be coming. He asked on two more occasions, but it was not until 20:30 that the painkillers arrived. Similarly when I needed a bed pan, the nurse said "Just a sec" and it was 30 minutes before it arrived, during which holding in my urine added greatly to my pain and discomfort. It is understandable if nurses have other urgent priorities to attend to first, but they should be trained to make truthful statements, such as "I need to attend to a patient giving birth first" rather than "just a sec" which raises hopes of something being likely to happen within about 5 minutes. I know the nursing staff were under a lot of pressure, but I was disappointed that urgent needs took so long to be seen to. The third doctor I saw on the morning before I left was excellent. Incidentally my husband had a message on his mobile asking for a review of his experience at the X-ray department, which was fine, but I have had no similar message on my mobile regarding X-ray and scan experiences (both OK) or my time in accident and emergency.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

title: Urology
body: I had to attend Haematuria Clinic in Urology under the 2 week pathway for tests so was obviously very apprehensive about results. The staff were very understanding and friendly and put me at ease. The examination was carried out in a very dignified manner which I appreciated. Fortunately l received good news.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Poor communication
body:
At our 20 week scan we were told we were having a girl, at a 35 week scan it was confirmed to actually be a boy. Then due to reduced moves had extra growth scans. Went for a 40 week growth scan the day before due date, arrived and was told my appointment had been cancelled 2 week‚Äôs previously but nobody had informed me of this, so waited for 20 minutes to be told this. 
On 3rd May went in as referred by midwife for pre-eclampsia, had bloods taken at 3pm, then was told they would take 2 hours to come back, doctor wanted us to wait at the hospital just incase. So we waited, it got to 6:30pm and we‚Äôd heard nothing, the Antenatal department had closed and nobody had told me that i had to go to the maternity triage. I then waited there for a further 2 hours, before asking reception why I wasn‚Äôt able to get my blood results back, was rudely told as needed a bed, even though my results had been waiting there now almost 3 hours at this point. Within 5 minutes I was called by a nurse, who didn‚Äôt take me into a room just down a hallway full of other patients (didn‚Äôt feel very professional or private) to be told nothing was wrong and that I could‚Äôve gone home hours ago.

The level of communication to patients within this department is absolutely shocking, to the point where I no longer plan on giving birth at this hospital because of how constantly let down I feel by the staff here. 
I really would not recommend the department to anyone else, and wish I had chosen a different hospital to begin with.

title: Unhelpful and unresponsive
body:
I don't visit the doctors very often as fortunately I am a very fit 58 year old going the gym to keep myself healthy 6 times a week. However I have had a viral/cold the last 2 weeks and have been treating myself a home instead of bothering the doctor. However I needed to see a doctor today 8th June 2023 as I have been experiencing breathing problems and not sleeping due to coughing during the night. 
I went to the surgery at 8.30 am and was told I was unable to see a doctor till the following Thursday. I was advised to ring 111 or go to A& E. 
I explained to the receptionist that I was really struggling and didn't they have any emergency appointments for that day or the following day and again was told there was nothing available until the following week.
While I appreciate all GPS and the overall NHS are struggling to be turned away and told to go to A & E when they are full to capacity dealing  with very sick people I find extremely disappointed and angry. 
I However then went to the old swan walk in centre who were absolutely fantastic, helpful and within an hour of waiting had seen a doctor and prescribed antibiotics and an inhaler for a lower and upper respiratory infection.

title: Atrocious
body: After months of continual cock-ups with prescriptions with the automatic 'Batch' service I have come off of that before I blew a fuse. I ordered my repeat prescriptions online last Friday and got a reply stating they would be at my chemist in 3 days. They are still not there and I have run out. Care to tell me why?

title: Entirely inadequate parking
body: I was unfortunate enough to attend Fairfield hosp today,to collect some prep from the Xray dept for my impending  scan for suspected cancer. I was unable to find a car park space in your tiny car parks available to visitors. I drove round and round in a stressed state along with a dozen other cars doing the same! In exasperation,  I parked on a double yellow line in a safe place along with the disabled drivers who had to park there. I knew I would be 10 mins at the most and I put a notice in my window explaining this. When I returned 10 mins later I had been issued with a penalty notice fine from the council!! I was so angry. Admittedly it was my fault but I was left with no alternative. What else was I supposed to do!! How many times a day is this happening to patients, elderly and vulnerable, sick and distressed attending appts unable to park, making them late for appts, causing untold extra stress for them. It is shocking. Of course there is no shortage of car park security and wardens circulating ready to pounce and regularly slap fines on cars of the vulnerable. It is just a money making ploy!! Disgusting!

title: Unbelievable a absolute joke
body: I wouldn't recommend this surgery to anyone the stuff are rude especially the receptionists that seem to think they can give you a medical Diagnosis over the phone or tell you that they don't feel you need to be seen. If you can get thought to get in the call queue for an appointment after listening to a 10 minute message before and after Selecting the option you need once all appointments are full even if you been on the phone since 8.30am the line cuts out. Some of the doctors are very rude and have nothing but a poor attitude, I understand the NHS in under huge stress but having 1 surgery to cover a whole area is just Ridiculous and they are still continuing to take on more and more patients when they haven't got the resources to accommodate the ones they've already had on their books. Worst surgery going

title: Superb Experience
body:
I had a GP appointment this morning. On arrival I was greeted by an extremely friendly receptionist. She was very helpful and listened to what I was saying. 
I returned in the afternoon for blood tests  and was greeted again by the same receptionist and her colleague. They were so very helpful and eager to help. 
I also saw the HCA who took bloods. She was so very kind and helpful. She gave me some great advice on health care. 
Thanks to you all. A great experience.

title: the crisis line is the worst service ever.
body: I had someone who needed urgent mental health advice. But no one picks up the phone, waited for 2hrs. Then call at three separate time and no one picks up. It says that I was first in the queue but had to wait 2hrs to finally get the message that no one will answer.

title: Incompetence of receptionist
body: After handing a sample to the receptionist which was labeled correctly. The sample has been lost and they have refused to accept it was an error on their part, adding they have no information about the sample even thought the receptionist physically took it from my hand. This has led to delays with my consultant.

title: Great practice
body:
Recently received radiotherapy treatment for prostate cancer.
Each of the Linac teams were efficient, friendly and extremely considerate to all patients. 
This is obviously routine for them but they manage to treat patients with respect and kindness. My experience was mainly with the Linac 4 team but visits to other reams was equally impressive.
Many thanks.

title: Stay clear
body:
I cannot stress enough how much you need to stay away from this place and exercise your NHS right to choose and go anywhere else as you cannot exercise your right to chose after already going through assessment 

I won‚Äôt bore you with all the details of what happened but please trust me in staying away from this place. Check out the google reviews for reference

title: Swift and timely
body: Decent scheduling (2 weeks post tests) and appointment on time and pleasingly quick - I‚Äôm sure more time would have been given if there had been problems and j was offered extra time for any questions I had.

title: Friendly efficient practice
body: As a new patient attending the practice ..staff were friendly helpful and the nurse was very friendly efficient

title: Poor care
body: My son struggled about 6 days of high temperature and bellyache. He spent on rainbow award 2 nights, nurses was very kind but the doctor care was very poor. Every day Ive been told, they will do blood test but from some reason nobody did it. Also last day the doctor told us my boy can goes home and if he get worst, get back to hospital and he also refused to do blood test even my boy still didn't feel well. Then only he noticed that my son had high temp the other night and changed his mind. I understand doctors are busy but once my son is in the hospital all what I need is proper medical care.

readBy.name: Wrightington, Wigan and Leigh NHS Trust

title: Excellent Practice
body:
Had a minor op which was superbly done by very efficient staff. I would give maximum stars for this practice over the many years I have been with them.
The ones giving one star moaning about waiting times should go to A&E if it‚Äôs that urgent and spend the day waiting to see a very overworked staff. I‚Äôll wait my turn at Stonefield St Surgery.

title: Poor service and not friendly
body:
Wallingford Gp Surgery is a busy practice with generally very good doctors ‚Ä¶ But, appointment staff are abrupt, sometimes rude, want to publicly know what your medical problem is in open plan and you can very much hardly Ever book an appointment on the same day or same week. You‚Äôre nearly always told to call back and book at 9am which is impossible to get through. 

Front office staff give off this vibe that you‚Äôre making life difficult for them in that they‚Äôre not friendly and speak down to patients. 

This GP surgery needs a total overhaul and clear understanding of what encompasses a friendly and helpful attitude to service. V poor - I‚Äôve even had the appointment staff slam the phone down on me when I lost mobile signal for just a brief second. 

We are currently looking around at better alternative surgeries.

title: Great practice
body:
Called GP at around 10am for emergency appt and doctor called me 
around 3pm after short conversation he called me to see him at 4.30 pm.
General check up done and prescribed me some medications. I am very happy the way things were done.

title: Poor practice
body: After seeing one doctor at the surgery who had recommended a course of action, further to having x rays and blood tests. When I booked a follow up appointment I was contacted by phone by a nurse who offered her opinion on my xrays when I pointed out to her that there was more than one issue to be dealt with she said she would make an appointment for me to see a doctor. Instead I received a text informing me the doctor  I had seen originally had left and that I would need to book another appointment. Which means I have to start the process all over again and go through the practices triage system which in itself is an ordeal. There is no way this practice offers continuity of care and it would seem to me and a lot of other patients they do there upmost to ensure you dont get to see a doctor.

title: Brilliant Service
body: Service was professional and efficiently run plus my therapist was wonderful. She equipped me with all the CBT techniques I needed to help me overcome severe depression. She also went over and above providing me with access to further advice and support

readBy.name: South London and Maudsley NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent care
body:
The physio had read my case notes and was well prepared for me.

He was kind and patient even when I misunderstood him

title: Very efficient
body: I went in for an appointment for phsyio on my foot. Then they noticed a bruise on my leg, to which a doc was called in to look. They took great measures to check and quickly got me seen to for a blood test. I‚Äôm glad the phsyio was on the ball and noticed my bruise. Thank you

title: Good service great attitude
body: I‚Äôm impressed how fast and good attitude this GP has. I have received a prompt and professional answers and actions from doctor!

title: Very poor service
body:
The Patch system is a waste of time. I do not understand why patients have to wait 10 days for a five minute phone call. It would be quicker to actually phone patients back as it is to send all these useless emails and text messages. 
I tried to phone the surgery (35 minutes on hold) to ask why the doctor had not phoned me back only to be told it was next week!!!! My fault I should have read the message properly but when you contact the surgery on a Monday you don't expect to be waiting 10 days. I very rarely use the doctors as I do not want to be a drain on the system but this is just ridiculous. 
Not surprised really when the surgery wastes time on pointless asthma reviews on patients who have had Asthma for 50 years with no change. Waste of time as I don't need to be shown how to use an inhaler!!!!

title: Brilliant
body: The experience I have had in the last few weeks have been brilliant everything went well with samples and test results can‚Äôt complain staff have been fantastic aswell

title: Great communication and helpful friendly staff
body: All very straight forward. Text reminders and confirmation‚Äôs of appointments are very useful as my memory is not what it used to be.
